title: A proper football man : Tributes flood in from across football after death of Radcliffe FC chairman Paul Hilton
body_text:
'A proper football man': Tributes flood in from across football after death of Radcliffe FC chairman Paul Hilton
'Paul was one of football’s true gentlemen, in every sense of the word'
Tributes from football in the north west and across the country are flooding in after the shock death of Radcliffe FC chairman Paul Hilton.
The club announced news of the death of its 'beloved' chairman today, calling him a 'driving force' not just for Radcliffe FC, but for the surrounding community.
As reported, Radcliffe FC's National League North game at home against Buxton on Saturday has been called off as a mark of respect after the passing of Mr Hilton. Clubs and organisations are now posting tributes, with his death expected to be marked at today's 3pm kick-offs. Rounds of applause during games have also been suggested.
READ MORE: Radcliffe FC announce shock death of 'beloved' chairman Paul Hilton
Radcliffe FC formed in 1949 as Radcliffe Borough. The club were promoted into the National League North as champions last season after 37 years in the Northern Premier League, with Mr Hilton credited with transforming its fortunes.
He became chairman of Radcliffe FC in 2016 and among a host of changes, launched Radcliffe FC Women - the first ever women's side to represent the town.
A former goalkeeper, Mr Hilton played for Bury FC youth team, and Radcliffe Juniors and men's teams before injury curtailed his playing in his early 20s. He then switched to football administration, his association with the then Radcliffe Borough starting from 2015. He also brought in junior football and remodelled the Neuven Stadium club's infrastructure.
The Northern Premier League paid tribute to 'a proper football man'. In a statement, the league said: "Paul joined the league in 2018 and had been the leading light behind the development of the NPL Digital Strategy. Paul was one of football’s true gentlemen, in every sense of the word.
"A proper football man with a business knowledge and dedication that saw Radcliffe FC develop on and off the pitch and helped many others in the local area. We send sincere condolences to Paul's wife Claire and daughter Charlotte and his family. He will be greatly missed by his many friends in the game."
The Manchester FA said it was 'shocked and saddened' to learn of his death. "Our thoughts are with his family and everyone at the club during this difficult time," read a statement.
Radcliffe FC Women said in a social media post: "Radcliffe FC Women are heartbroken at the very sad news that Radcliffe FC Chairman Paul Hilton passed away suddenly last night . We wish to send our heartfelt condolences to Paul's family and friends at this very sad time."
Bury FC said: "We're saddened to learn of Paul's passing this morning. He will be greatly missed in the local area, a massive advocate for non-league football, and has progressed Radcliffe proudly in his eight years as chairman. Our thoughts are with Paul's family and everyone at Radcliffe FC today."
Tributes are also pouring in from other amateur clubs across Greater Manchester. Droylsden FC wrote on X, formerly Twitter: "Everyone at the club sends thoughts and condolences to the family, friends and colleagues of Paul Hilton at Radcliffe. Paul will be sadly missed by the Manchester football fraternity."
West Manchester FC, Belper Town, Darlington FC and Corby Town FC are among other clubs posting tributes today.
In a statement, Radcliffe FC said: "It is with profound sadness that we announce the passing of our beloved Chairman, Paul Hilton. Paul was not just the driving force behind Radcliffe Football Club; he was the very heart and soul of our community. His unwavering dedication, vision, and tireless efforts transformed our club, leading us to the highest level in our history.
"Paul’s passion for the game and his commitment to the players, staff, and supporters will be sorely missed. He had an extraordinary ability to bring people together, fostering a sense of unity and belonging that made our club truly special.
"At this difficult time, we kindly ask everyone to respect the privacy of Paul’s family. Please allow his loved ones the space they need to grieve and remember the remarkable man that Paul was. We encourage all members of our community to come together in memory of Paul, celebrating not only his contributions to our club but also the legacy of kindness and camaraderie he leaves behind. More information about memorial services and ways to pay tribute will be shared in due course.
"Thank you for your understanding and support during this sad period."
